Job Title: Automation Technician

Location: Andover, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
#ChangeMakers

Ready to make an impact?

We develop, manufacture, and supply dental implants, clear aligners, instruments, CADCAM prosthetics and biomaterials for use in esthetic dentistry, tooth replacement and restoration solutions or to prevent tooth loss.

We empower our employees to perform and make an impact, to question the status quo, to drive change, to stay ahead of the competition. From the first Dental Implant in 1974 to the latest Digital Solution – we do things differently than others

We deliver innovation based on evidence. This is part of our employer culture as well as an exceptional team spirit that truly encourages diversity and a powerful “can-do” attitude.

#WeChangeDentistry every day. Be part of it.

Position Summary

This position provides technical support to the Process Improvement and Technology department at the Straumann Manufacturing site in Andover, Massachusetts by ensuring all equipment and processes are performing at maximum efficiency and up-time. This is a hands-on technical position in a high-volume automated production environment requiring knowledge of electro-mechanical diagnosis and repair. Other duties as assigned by the head of Process Improvement and Technology.

Job Responsibilities

This position is responsible for, but not limited to, the following (* indicates essential function):

 Responsible for manufacturing systems up-time across most areas of the operation. Assist engineering team in implementing process improvement projects, including but not limited to core technology of robots and visions systems. Diagnose and repair of existing automation equipment which includes PLC, HMI, robots, vision software, mechanical / electrical /pneumatic devices. Assist in the development and implementation of fixturing and systems leading to process improvements. Responsible for adherence to preventive maintenance procedures of equipment. Ensure all equipment and processes operate in accordance with established environmental, health and safety procedures. Assist in maintaining job related processes / work instructions. Participate in meeting departmental goals and objectives. Other duties as assigned by the head of Process Improvement and Technology.

The responsibilities listed herein are not intended to be a comprehensive list of the duties and responsibilities of the position. The duties and responsibilities may change without notice.

Physical Attributes

 Sit/stand for 8 hours Bend, crouch and reach continuously while performing required job tasks.

Work Environment

 General production environment.

Minimum Qualifications

 High School diploma or equivalent. 3+ years relevant experience in a high-volume manufacturing environment. 3+ years of experience with electronics, mechanics, pneumatics, robotics and computers. 3+ years interpreting drawings, PLC logic, pneumatic and electric schematics.

Preferred Qualifications

 Knowledge of GMP and ISO standards Effective verbal and written communication skills Advanced analytical problem-solving skills Technical aptitude of automation and ability to adjust and fine-tune components Interpersonal skills Experience with AB Studio 5000, Factory Talk View Studio, Cognex In-Sight Explorer, and Keyence Vision System software preferred

Additional Information

Whether you’re looking to build your career, improve your health, or brighten your SMILE, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals.

 Very Competitive total compensation plans (some positions include discretionary bonus, or Performance Share Units). A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future with an employer match Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you’re happy and healthy. Straumann contributes a healthy portion towards employees’ premium. Generous PTO allowance - plenty of time to recharge those batteries!

Please understand that we do not need external support by recruiting agencies and consultants to fill this vacancy. Thank you for respecting this.

Videos To Watch

https://youtu.be/3lq5BLAvIdQ

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Alternative Locations: United States : Andover (MA)
